specificEvents.name: A Figure of Speech [Daniel Morden]
specificEvents.description: Come and hear stories of ridiculous and sometimes horrific bodies; these funny and macabre stories are the perfect way to celebrate a spooky month!

specificEvents.name: In the time of GIANTS [The Travelling Talesman]
In the time of GIANTS [The Travelling Talesman]
In the time of GIANTS [The Travelling Talesman]
In the time of GIANTS [The Travelling Talesman]
Uncanny [Nell Phoenix]
Dreaming the Great Bear [Nick Hennessey]
specificEvents.description: Here in the Finnish far north the light is just a little too bright and the dark a little too blinding, the rivers flow fast and deep and it’s all too easy to get lost in the forest. Internationally acclaimed storyteller and musician Nick Hennessey forges a world into being. With electric harp, vocal looping and acoustic wizardry, he conjures a cosmos of the imagination. Expect a remarkable, elemental epic and a world of sound as we enter the wild, playful, and surreal territories of the Finnish myth, the Kalevala.
specificEvents.location: Sandford Orcas Village Hall, Dorchester, DT9 4RX

specificEvents.name: Dreaming the Great Bear [Nick Hennessey]
specificEvents.description: Here in the Finnish far north the light is just a little too bright and the dark a little too blinding, the rivers flow fast and deep and it's all too easy to get lost in the forest. Internationally acclaimed storyteller and musician Nick Hennessey forges a world into being. With electric harp, vocal looping and acoustic wizardry, he conjures a cosmos of the imagination. Expect a remarkable, elemental epic and a world of sound as we enter the wild, playful, and surreal territories of the Finnish myth, the Kalevala.

specificEvents.name: Dreaming the Great Bear [Nick Hennessey]
specificEvents.description: Here in the Finnish far north the light is just a little too bright and the dark a little too blinding, the rivers flow fast and deep and it’s all too easy to get lost in the forest. Internationally acclaimed storyteller and musician Nick Hennessey forges a world into being. With electric harp, vocal looping and acoustic wizardry, he conjures a cosmos of the imagination. Expect a remarkable, elemental epic and a world of sound as we enter the wild, playful, and surreal territories of the Finnish myth, the Kalevala.

specificEvents.name: Madness, Merry Making and Liberation [Sarah Dovey]
specificEvents.description: Dionysus is a God of many facets. Some may know him as the God of wine and merrymaking and it’s not hard to see why that has become one of his most popular aspects. But along with the feasting and indulgence he also brings divine madness. And further still he stands for liberation and rebellion against the social and gender based norms that are so often forced upon us. Tales of Dionysus are tales of joy and freedom, tales of blood and tales of the extremes of human nature.\n\n This evening, Sarah Dovey will explore the many aspects of Dionysus by telling stories of his life, his loves and his vengeance.

specificEvents.name: Beyond the Glass Mountain [Cath Little & Bronia Evers]
Stories Under the Stars: Fireside Myth & Music for Grown Ups [Nick & Emily Hennessey]
specificEvents.showname: Stories Under the Stars: Fireside Myth & Music for Grown Ups
specificEvents.description: An evening of cosmic stories, soaring through worlds of gods, queens, heroes, mythical creatures and... shopping trolleys!?

specificEvents.name: The Mighty Goddess [Sally Pomme Clayton]
specificEvents.description: The Goddess is coming.... Enter the pine forest. Meet: Creator; Mother; Lover; Virgin; Crone. Bring a burning question and get an answer from the goddess's oracle! Be prepared for X_rated stories! Adults only.

specificEvents.name: Protest Days, Rebellion Nights: songs and stories of the Luddites [Monty + The AnyWhens]
specificEvents.showname: Protest Days, Rebellion Nights: songs and stories of the Luddites

specificEvents.name: The Goddess of Spreadsheets [Tim Ralphs]
specificEvents.description: A position has just opened in our More-than-Human Resources Department! As the heroic head of the hiring committee for the divine pantheon, it's up to you to put together a team of sacred scribes, astral accountants and celestial problem-solvers. Tim has got the candidates for you to consider. With the right team of Godly governors in place, this incorporeal corporation is going places.

specificEvents.name: Welsh Whisperers: Story Circle
specificEvents.description: Come and join the Dragon Storytellers in the Story Circle. Listen to their stories about Barmouth and Wales: some traditional, some written especially for the Welsh Whisperers Storytelling project. All are warmly invited to share a story of their own if they wish, in the Welsh language, bilingually or in English.

specificEvents.showname: Tales of Winter Magic - evening storytelling and Mummers' play

specificEvents.name: Lilith: The Other Side of the Story [Katy Cawkwell]
specificEvents.showname: Lilith: The Other Side of the Story

specificEvents.name: The Hairy Girl [Kersti Stabi]
Tales of Winter and Christmas [Lichfield Storytellers Christmas get together]
specificEvents.description: Traditional Christmas get together with songs and stories from local tellers - mince pies, crackers and cracker jokes, conviviality and mirth

specificEvents.name: Warm Hearted Christmas Stories [Cath Edwards & Matt Vaughan]

specificEvents.location: Carvel Lane Coffee House, Cowes, PO31 7TF
specificEvents.name: Winter Tales [Tony "Monty" Hirst]
Tom Thumb [Amelia Ace Armande]
specificEvents.description:
It's the time of King Arthur, and young Tom wants more than anything to be a knight at the court of Camelot. There's just one problem: Tom is only the size of a thumb, and he has a bad habit of being eaten. Eaten by wolves and horses and cows and giants and...

 A madcap journey through many stomachs and many adventures, this is a 17th century fairytale for telling around tavern tables and at twelfth night feasts.Amelia Ace Armande brings to life one of Britain's most overlooked folklore heroes on his quest for recognition and glory.

 A tale of heart, soul, and plenty of guts!

specificEvents.name: Dark tales for dark nights — Christmas special [P. D. Brown]
specificEvents.showname: Dark tales for dark nights — Christmas special

specificEvents.name: A Dance with the Minotaur's Sister [Steph Brittain]
specificEvents.showname: A Dance with the Minotaur’s Sister
specificEvents.description: Join storyteller Steph Brittain as she follows Ariadne’s journey as it unravels through the maze of love, betrayal, loss, joy and the bulls and the bees. Before the thread and before the tangled and twisted maze, there was Ariadne full of life and rhythm. From a dance floor in the forest and the labyrinth's twisting and tangled passages to the starry skies of the Island of Naxos, Steph Brittain weaves an intricate tapestry of love, strength and courage.
specificEvents.location: Our Lady of the Assumption Church Hall, Beeston, Nottingham, NG9 1AE

specificEvents.name: Once Upon an Oddity: Deliciously Strange Tales for Winter Nights [ Mark Fraser]
specificEvents.showname: Once Upon an Oddity: Deliciously Strange Tales for Winter Nights
specificEvents.description: Mark Fraser is an itinerant storyteller, traversing the land with his original tales and weird stories. Join him for a selection of the odd, ghastly and vaguely unsettling tales from his own brain and around the world. A dark hour of devilish deeds and strange characters, just perfect for a dark winter’s evening. A writer, an artist and the master of the bizarre story, Mark brings twenty years of storytelling experience to Wonder Monger at Cambridge Junction.

specificEvents.name: Dog Almighty! A Trickster show for Grown-Ups [Emily Hennessey]
specificEvents.showname: Dog Almighty! A Trickster show for Grown-Up
specificEvents.description:
Wild, irreverent, stupid, wise, dangerous and outrageously rude, Coyote has questions.
 BIG Questions.

 Looking for answers he crosses land and sky, breaks the rules, dances with illusion, cheats death and wreaks havoc at every turn. 

 Emily Hennessey stumbles through the chaos of parenthood and life while celebrating the great First Nation trickster, the original creator and fool, riffing on the blues and high on himself.
 Raw, rough and close to the edge.

 A storytelling show for adults.

specificEvents.name: Beowulf: Storytelling for Grown-Ups [Hugh Lupton]
specificEvents.description:
Beowulf is the oldest story in the English language - and it still has the power to raise the hairs on the back of the neck!
 It tells of a hero’s life, a life that is mapped by three tremendous blood- curdling encounters.
 As a young man Beowulf defeats the monster Grendel and his even more terrifying Mother, the original creatures from the Black Lagoon.Then, as an old man, he tries his strength against a gold guarding Fire - Drake(a dragon).
 Alongside these adrenalin - charged encounters the story explores the journey we all make from the seeming invincibility of youth to the heroic vulnerability of old age.The story has had a tremendous effect on the imagination of many writers and poets, most notably J.R.R.Tolkien.Without Beowulf there would have been no Lord of the Rings.
 'Impossibly engaging storytelling' The Guardian
 Aimed at adults.

specificEvents.name: At Winters Heart (Solstice Storytelling) [Henry Moore & Hannah Sneyd]
specificEvents.description: Dartmoor-based storytellers Henry Everett and Hannah Sneyd promise a rich evening of tales crafted especially for the Solstice. Blending traditional stories from around the world with original tales inspired by the land and the deepening shadows of the season, we will gather together to bring light, joy, and depth to this midwinter moment.

specificEvents.name: Haunting Tales and Festive Cheer [Royal Tales story club, Sutton Coldfield]
specificEvents.performer: Royal Tales story club, Sutton Coldfield
specificEvents.location: The Station Pub, Sutton Coldfield, B73 6AT

specificEvents.name: The Dead of Winter [Merl Fluin & Holly Medland]
specificEvents.description:
__Chilling tales for the Festive Season.__

 Step in from the cold and enjoy the fine tradition of ghost stories for the festive season. Storytellers Merl Fluin and Holly Medland will take you on a journey to the places where wraiths walk at night.

 The cafe will be open from 6: 30pm, serving hot food, drinks and delicious cakes to help keep the chill at bay. Storytelling starts at 7:15pm.

specificEvents.name: Mad Sprits and Wild Gods [Henry Everett]
specificEvents.description: Prepare to be led astray into the medieval tales of Kent’s beloved trickster, mischievous Faerie, Robin Goodfellow.\n\n Next we will travel to the furthest reaches of Ancient Greece to quake in the stories of the Great God Pan… Both beings are untethered and unruly, wild spirits of the land.
specificEvents.location: The Folk Preservation Society, Teignmouth, TQ14 8DZ

specificEvents.name: Kukolka [Ronnie Conboy]
specificEvents.description: Kukolka is a weaving of traditional Slavic wondertales with 20th century wartime narrative. At the heart of it all, the wisdom of Baba Yaga questions what choices are made, when all good choices are gone.

specificEvents.name: At Winters Heart (Solstice Storytelling) [Henry Moore & Hannah Sneyd]
specificEvents.description: Dartmoor-based storytellers Henry Everett and Hannah Sneyd promise a rich evening of tales crafted especially for the Solstice. Blending traditional stories from around the world with original tales inspired by the land and the deepening shadows of the season, we will gather together to bring light, joy, and depth to this midwinter moment.
specificEvents.location: The Circle Barn, Beden, Sampford Spiney, PL20 6LF

specificEvents.name: The Snow Queen [Vanessa Woolf]
specificEvents.location: Asylum Chapel, Asylum Rd, London, SE15 2SQ

specificEvents.name: Arnside Sailing Club — Storyteller [Nick Hennessey]
specificEvents.description: On the Sunday before Christmas, an afternoon show with Nick Hennessey, an internationally acclaimed storyteller, playwright, folk singer, song writer, harpist and musician.  He has performed at venues such as the South Bank, Barbican, Royal Albert Hall and festivals worldwide, He has broadcast on Radio 4 and his music played on Radio 3. Nick has a particular interest in the story telling tradition of Finland. He will take you to the snow filled forests of the Far North, the darkness of the winter night and the warmth of the winter fire, travelling by song, story and music.
specificEvents.location: The Old Customs House, Arnside, Carnforth, LA5 0HD

specificEvents.name: Comb [Sarah Mooney]
specificEvents.description:
I saw a banshee once, just outside of Galway...

When Charlotte was 8 her Grandad told her the beginning of a story but refused to tell the full tale.Years later a chance encounter led her to find the rest of his story buried deep within an archive gathered from families in Ireland.Not only did she discover this unbelievable link to her past but also the more startling realisation that she might actually be cursed.

At times chilling, hilarious and moving Comb is a lament for the stories and people we have lost.Through a tangled ride into Celtic, Slavic and Siberian folklore, it is a clarion call for understanding just how interwoven we all are.
specificEvents.location: All Saints Church Hall, Matlock Bank, DE4 3JG

specificEvents.name: Storytelling Around The Fire - Warm Tales for Winter [Vanessa Woolf]
specificEvents.showname: Storytelling Around The Fire - Warm Tales for Winter
specificEvents.description: Gather by the warmth of the fire in our truly beautiful location. Relax and enjoy glorious, mystical, magical tales from storyteller Vanessa to light up the winter dark. Hot chocolate and marshmallows will be available. We will be sitting around the fire- but it is outside... so dress in your cosiest layers! [Limited tickets]
specificEvents.location: Plot 9 Maze Hill, Greenwich, London, SE3 7RD

specificEvents.name: The Bodies on the Beach: The epic Irish myth of Fionn MacCumhaill [Ben Haggarty & Steph Brittain ]
specificEvents.showname: The Bodies on the Beach: The epic Irish myth of Fionn MacCumhaill
specificEvents.description:
A fatherless son,
 A daughter’s lament,
 A pig stolen from its spit,
 Fires burning out at sea,
 And a dream.

  On the westernmost tip of Ireland, a beach of crystal white sand once ran crimson with the blood of a never- ending magical battle — the last battle fought by the epic hero, Fionn MacCumhaill. 

 Ben Haggarty and Steph Brittain share a work -in -progress, picking through and piecing together fragments of voices, medieval manuscript, and song that tell a story of love and loss.

 Raw, lyrical, and unforgettable.This is not just a wild myth retold.It's an exploration of what it means to live, to regret, to sacrifice, and to endure in a relentless world.
 What will survive the tide? 

 This performance is followed by an opportunity for post-show discussion and is part of a Research and Development project funded by the Arts Council of England.

 Two halves 60 mins.Age recommendation 16 +

  Content advice: This show contains references to threat, violence and mutilation, incest, death in childbirth, and suicide, all contextualised within a paradigm of mythic narrative, archetype and metaphor.
specificEvents.location: Llanover Hall Arts Center, Cardiff, CF5 1FH

specificEvents.name: Tales and Ales — Tombs and Roses by Word of Mouth [P. D. Brown] [P. D. Brown]
specificEvents.showname: Tales and Ales — Tombs and Roses by Word of Mouth

specificEvents.name: Welsh Whisperers [Gillian Brownson + Dragon Storytellers]
specificEvents.description: Come and listen to stories about kings and queens, the Tylwyth Teg and fairies, dragons and monsters and ordinary people as well. Stories of Barmouth, Gwynedd and Wales, stories from long ago and tomorrow. The Dragon Storytellers will be joined by professional storyteller Gillian Brownson.

specificEvents.name: The Girl Who Married a Dog [Nell Phoenix]
specificEvents.showname: The Girl Who Married a Dog

specificEvents.name: Tall Tales and Tiny Truths ['Tis Tales]
specificEvents.description: Tall Tales and Tiny Truths - stories of wit, wisdom and wonder, with maybe just a tiny touch of truth woven in. Myths and mischief, legends and lies, these stories are made to be spoken and shared in good company. Brought to you by Holly Medland, Sue Bailey and Tony 'Monty' Hirst.

specificEvents.name: The Fire, The Flame, and the Light [Maria Buckley Whatton]
specificEvents.showname: The Fire, The Flame, and the Light
specificEvents.description:
A baby born with a blue flame of hair
 A cursed horse and doomed lovers.
 A glorious Saint who presides over an Irish chip shop.
 Join us on Wed 21st Jan and let Maria Whatton stir the seeds of Spring with her stories! There will be a flaming goddess, a startling saint, Mary of Kildare, and many more besides.

specificEvents.name: Peronik: The Diary In The Attic [Marion Leeper]
specificEvents.showname: Peronik: The Diary In The Attic
specificEvents.description: Across myth and memory, two young men set out on separate quests: one for treasure, one for love. But both must beware the ogres waiting in the dark.
specificEvents.location: St. John's Church Hall, Worcester Park, KT4 7NY

specificEvents.name: The Girl Who Married a Dog [Nell Phoenix]
specificEvents.showname: The Girl Who Married a Dog

specificEvents.name: Last Orders - A Storytelling Show [Mike Payton]
specificEvents.description: Three strangers gather in the corner of an inn, leaving the darkness of the road. As the windows rattle and the optics glow, their memories grow hazy but they cling to the stories that have nourished them on their journeys. But why are they there? And who is calling for them from the upstairs bar, ever more insistently? Inspired by The Canterbury Tales, the Cohen Brothers and quite a few lost nights in the pub, Mike Payton reflects on the stories that make us and keep us tethered to the world. One more for the road…
specificEvents.location: The Old Stables, behind The White Hart, Cricklade, Swindon, SN6 6AA

specificEvents.name: Tales By The Teign [Shane Ibbs]
specificEvents.location: The Folk Preservation Society, Teignmouth, TQ14 8DZ

specificEvents.name: Work in Progress: Berserker [Marcus Pibworth]
specificEvents.description:
A Wild Norse Epic retold by Storyteller Marcus Pibworth
 A kingdom shivers beneath the shadow of a winged terror.
 Kings rise, kings fall and betrayal coils in every hall.
 Warriors hunger for the clash of steel. Whispers of old sorcery stir in the dark places of the world.
 Old wounds demand their due. Revenge begets revenge.
 Can Bodvar Bjarki—bear-strong, battle-scarred—rally the king’s champions and lead them across the frozen breadth of the Northlands, outwitting gods and men, toward a destiny where only the bravest may stand against the gathering doom?
 Born of the same ancient narrative root that gave rise to the Old English epic Beowulf, but treading a path into strange and mysterious realms of its own, Marcus Pibworth’s darkly comic retelling of an Old Norse saga leads you deep into the uncharted wilds of myth and legend.
specificEvents.location: University of South Wales, Cardiff Campus (CAB218), Cardiff CF24 2FN

specificEvents.name: Tales That Topple Tyrants: Live Storytelling for Grownups [Merl Fluin]
specificEvents.showname: Tales That Topple Tyrants: Live Storytelling for Grownups
specificEvents.description: Once upon a time there was a very bad king. He stole from his subjects, laid waste to the land, told outrageous lies, declared war on his neighbours, and always got his own way...\n\nExcept he didn’t.

specificEvents.name: The Stealing of the Sun and Moon [Nick Hennessey]
specificEvents.showname: The Stealing of the Sun and Moon
specificEvents.description: oin Nick for a performance that journeys into the deep, snow-filled forests of the Finnish far north, where the river of the underworld flows dark and fast, and the summer sun shines just a little too bright. In this world created from shards of eggshell, the sun and moon are fought over, magic is done and undone, and life is shot through with bizarre ordeals, misguided passions, magical battles and transformations. Expect a remarkable performance of elemental epic.
specificEvents.location: Our Lady of the Assumption Church Hall, Beeston, Nottingham, NG9 1AE

specificEvents.name: The Homing Stone [Hugh Lupton]
specificEvents.description:
Arthur Ransome is well known as the author of the 'Swallows and Amazons' books. What is less well known is that as a young man he went to Russia to collect folk-tales and was swept into the maelstrom of the Russian Revolution. During the six years he lived in Moscow he became the only British journalist trusted by the Bolsheviks. He played chess with Lenin and fell in love with Trotsky's secretary Evgenia Shelepina. In England he was regarded with profound suspicion as a possible Soviet agent.

 In 1919 when Moscow was surrounded by counter- revolutionaries, he and Evgenia escaped.They travelled through Estonia with a horse and cart knowing they would be shot if recognised.

 In the Homing Stone master storyteller Hugh Lupton (who is also Ransome's great - nephew) tells the epic tale of that perilous and extraordinary journey.'s great-nephew) tells the epic tale of that perilous and extraordinary journey.
specificEvents.location: The Backyard Theatre, Watchet, West Somerset, TA23 0AZ

specificEvents.name: In the time of GIANTS [The Travelling Talesman]
specificEvents.description:
They are big and some of them are clever (not many though!). Europe used to be thick with them.

 From Greek Zeus to Scandinavian Thor and from Cornwall’s Jack the Hammer to the northern Molly Whuppie, Gods and humans have waged a devastating series of single combats against large and grotesque beings with dubious manners.In many myths the giants come first, often preceding even the gods themselves, frequently waiting for the human explorers of new lands.

 Often a force of oppression, representing the tyranny of might, some have their beginnings in the power of nature, some in actual people who have been exaggerated over the years and some we can only guess at.

specificEvents.name: Stars and their Consolations [Daniel Morden, Hugh Lupton & Sarah Lianne Lewis]
specificEvents.performer: Daniel Morden | Hugh Lupton | Sarah Lianne Lewis
specificEvents.description: A majestic, intimate and hypnotic re-imagining of Greek myths and legends weaving ancient stories, cosmic projections and a spine-tingling electro-acoustic soundscape.

specificEvents.description:
The graphic novel, adapted as traditional storytelling, for modern audiences.
 A tale of ancient Celtic heroes and villains, monsters and magic, dragons and demons, and goddesses and gods; all this live online (or watch later), from the comfort of your own home. In partnership with 2000 AD and Rebellion Publishing.

musicEvents.name: Gaz Brookfield and The Company of Thieves, (Waiting For Wisdom tour)
musicEvents.performer: Gaz Brookfield and The Company of Thieves
musicEvents.description: Following the release of his tenth studio album, Waiting For Wisdom, Gaz Brookfield takes to the road once more. Folk / Punk festival favourite, Brookfield has been at this for a while now.Since winning Acoustic Magazine Singer/ Songwriter of the year way back in 2010 he has continued to tirelessly tour the length and breadth of the country, building a strong and loyal following where he goes. \n\n His last album, Morning Walking Club, saw Gaz achieve his first top 40 record, and it even got number 1 in the UK Official Folk Charts.Not a bad result for this fiercely independent musician, with no record label, no manager, and no agent — just a guitar, a van, and a steadfastly belligerent refusal to give in.
